## Purpose
Console renderable component that draws bordered panels around content in the Rich terminal formatting library. Supports customizable borders, titles, styling, and padding for creating visually distinct content areas.

## Core Classes

### Panel (L17-293)
Main renderable class inheriting from `JupyterMixin`. Creates bordered containers for any renderable content.

**Key Methods:**
- `__init__` (L38-69): Constructor accepting renderable content, box style, title/subtitle, alignment, styling, dimensions, and padding options
- `fit` (L71-105): Class method constructor that sets `expand=False` for content-fitted panels
- `__rich_console__` (L139-270): Core rendering logic that builds border segments and handles title/subtitle placement
- `__rich_measure__` (L272-292): Calculates panel dimensions considering padding and content requirements

**Key Properties:**
- `_title` (L108-121): Processes title text, converting strings to Text objects with markup support, normalizing newlines and adding padding
- `_subtitle` (L124-137): Similar processing for subtitle text

## Internal Functions

### align_text (L157-199)
Local function within `__rich_console__` that handles text alignment within borders. Supports left, center, and right alignment by adding appropriate spacing characters with border styling.

## Dependencies
- `.box`: Border styling (ROUNDED default)
- `.text`: Text objects and markup processing
- `.padding`: Content padding management
- `.segment`: Terminal output segments
- `.measure`: Size calculation utilities
- `.align`: Text alignment enums
- `.style`: Styling system

## Architectural Patterns
- **Rich Protocol**: Implements `__rich_console__` and `__rich_measure__` for console rendering
- **Factory Pattern**: `fit()` class method provides alternative construction
- **Lazy Properties**: Title/subtitle processing deferred until rendering
- **Generator-based Rendering**: Uses yield statements for segment-by-segment output

## Key Features
- Configurable box styles (rounded, double, etc.)
- Optional titles and subtitles with independent alignment
- Automatic or fixed dimensions
- Padding support around content
- Style inheritance and border-specific styling
- Safe box character fallback for legacy terminals
- Highlight support for content

## Critical Constraints
- Minimum width of 4 characters required for title/subtitle display
- Panel adds 2 characters width for borders
- Height calculations account for top/bottom borders
- Title/subtitle text is normalized (no newlines, tab expansion)
